title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create an interactive element:
Click Me!
Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the box 2. When clicked, toggles a 'highlighted' class 3. Also changes the textContent to show if it's highlighted or normal CSS (already defined): .normal { background: gray; } .highlighted { background: yellow; }
instructions:
Create an interactive element:
Click Me!
Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the box 2. When clicked, toggles a 'highlighted' class 3. Also changes the textContent to show if it's highlighted or normal CSS (already defined): .normal { background: gray; } .highlighted { background: yellow; }

commonMistakes.consequence: element.style.background-color causes a syntax error; hyphens aren't valid in property names.
element.style.width = 200 has no effect because CSS needs units.
commonMistakes.correction: Always include units as a string: element.style.width = '200px';
